They know the market, so can we engage with them again? I would say that probably this year, more than any other year, there are possibly more pitch situations that Korn Ferry would be in, and I think that's really that we've been under pressure as a team to actually make sure that we assess and make the right judgment call in terms of supplier. fullTranscript.speaker: Speaker 1 7:27
fullTranscript.text: Yes, so again, not just myself, but others in the team, have regular catch ups with Hillary and the team at Korn Ferry, and these are well, with the head of exec search. fullTranscript.speaker: Interviewer 8:10
fullTranscript.text: Okay, great. And in terms of the quality and quantity of candidates, did they meet your expectations?

fullTranscript.speaker: Speaker 1 8:19
fullTranscript.text: Yes, again, all of the projects that I've partnered with them on to date, they have absolutely presented impressive long lists and then short lists. fullTranscript.speaker: Interviewer 8:44
fullTranscript.text: Yeah, and in terms of, I suppose, managing the end to end process, how involved did they get from the beginning of, I suppose, building out the job description, identifying the skills that were needed and the type of person through to, you know, kind of compensation and negotiation at the end.

fullTranscript.speaker: Speaker 1 9:03
fullTranscript.text: Yeah, I would say that they, yeah, they, they partner very well with us on that, you know, and I don't, I wouldn't necessarily say that all search firms are as adept and thorough in doing, doing all of those aspects that you've talked about there, but it has felt a true partnership. I mean, we generally have quite a sorry, we generally will have quite a detailed job spec and requirements to share with them, -- 2 of 5 -- but they certainly always helped refine that and play back to us to ensure that, you know, they have totally understood what our requirements are. And then also, when it comes to Office day, well, then going to market, they've always advised in terms of comp levels and what we should expect to pay given the talent we're needing. And then when it comes to the office stage, again, I would say it's a true partnership in that we very much share with them the art of the possible, and they then work very, very hard in terms of getting all of the detail compromise that we need from the successful plan to date to ensure that we get to an offer, successful offer. I think that because they've worked with us a lot, they also understand our sometimes quite long winded approvals process and what that entails. And they also, again, because they've worked with us a lot, understand all of the different elements of the Comp of the candidate that we need to understand.

fullTranscript.speaker: Interviewer 10:43
fullTranscript.text: Did you especially interesting to kind of dig into this, because you've obviously been on their side. So how much did they utilize and would you and do you expect them to use things like their assessment tools and their pay benchmarks through a typical search.

fullTranscript.speaker: Speaker 1 11:06
fullTranscript.text: Yes, so less so on the pay side, but certainly on the assessment side. I mean all of our successful and sometimes the final two candidates are assessed by Korn Ferry. So yes, that's always utilized, and utilized very well. And I think, you know, as an organization, we get a great richness of data from that, and that sometimes used, not necessarily to determine whether or not the person will be offered the role, but quite often it's actually we're going to offer this is more as a development tool for when they land.

fullTranscript.speaker: Interviewer 11:46
fullTranscript.text: And is that something that everyone or the other competitors offer as well as it, and is it part of the overall proposal, or is it an

fullTranscript.text: add on? It's typically an add on, but I would say that over the last 345, years, more and more exec search firms have been offering their own assessment services as well. But you know, to date, we have stayed contractually with Korn Ferry,

fullTranscript.speaker: Interviewer 12:19
fullTranscript.text: great and just going back to that first point of what you know when to call them, and obviously people have their individual preferences. fullTranscript.speaker: Speaker 1 13:58
fullTranscript.text: It's the individuals in the network. Absolutely, it's not the Korn Ferry brand, quite frankly, through I mean, clearly that helps them get on the PSL. But you know, if, if the team, particularly Hillary, Samira, Meda, if they went to another search firm, there would be a strong pull for us to want to continue to partner with them.

fullTranscript.speaker: Interviewer 14:24
fullTranscript.text: -- 3 of 5 -- Okay, that's really helpful. And I mean, you know, what could they do better if one or two things that that you would love to see from them,

fullTranscript.speaker: Speaker 1 14:39
fullTranscript.text: I think it's hard to pinpoint anything. I think the you know, I've only had one occasion where I talked about, you know, not being blindsided. And as I said earlier, you know, they truly do keep the loop. They check things with us before they move forward. fullTranscript.speaker: Interviewer 15:43
